document_data.name: ''Land of Preening Dragons: Words of a Retired Wizard of War''
document_data.author: [[Garen Thal]]
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Land of Preening Dragons: Words of a Retired Wizard of War''''' was a [[book]] penned by [[Garen Thal]], a Loremaster of [[Cormyr]], in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|For young noble scions in [[Suzail]], one of the most important duties is the noble's social, a particular type of event orchestrated to force participants to dance with friends, both old and new. This allows eligible lads and lasses to meet new and interesting potential mates. More than one death-defying adventure has been known to erupt from such liaisons.|Excerpt from ''Land of Preening Dragons: Words of a Retired Wizard of War''}}
document_data.Contents: Garen Thal's work collected lore, thoughts, and rumination of a loremaster and a retired [[War Wizard]] on various topics including the practices and habits of Cormyte nobility, especially the young nobles from the Forest Kingdom's capital city.
document_data.History: ''Land of Preening Dragons: Words of a Retired Wizard of War'' was published in the {{YearlinkName|1381}}.
